  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. #if _MSC_VER >= 1400 && _MSC_VER < 1700
  19. /* Microsoft introduced a regression in Visual Studio 2005 (technically it's
  20.    not present in the Windows Server 2003 SDK which has a pre-release version)
  21.    and the abort function ceased to be declared __declspec(noreturn). This was
  22.    fixed in Visual Studio 2012. Trick stdlib.h into not defining abort (this
  23.    means exit and _exit are not defined either, but they aren't required). */
  24. ‌#define _CRT_TERMINATE_DEFINED
  25. __declspec(noreturn) void __cdecl abort(void);
  26. #endif

  49. ‌void caml_failed_assert (char * expr, char_os * file_os, int line)
  50. {
  51.   char* file = caml_stat_strdup_of_os(file_os);
  52.   fprintf(stderr, "[%02d] file %s; line %d ### Assertion failed: %s\n",
  53.           (Caml_state_opt != NULL) ? Caml_state_opt->id : -1, file, line, expr);
  54.   fflush(stderr);
  55.   caml_stat_free(file);
  56.   abort();
  57. }
  58. #endif

  60. #if defined(DEBUG)
  61. ‌static __thread int noalloc_level = 0;
  62. ‌int caml_noalloc_begin(void)
  63. {
  64.   return noalloc_level++;
  65. }
  66. ‌void caml_noalloc_end(int* noalloc)
  67. {
  68.   int curr = --noalloc_level;
  69.   CAMLassert(*noalloc == curr);
  70. }
  71. ‌void caml_alloc_point_here(void)
  72. {
  73.   CAMLassert(noalloc_level == 0);
  74. }
  75. #endif /* DEBUG */

  77. ‌#define GC_LOG_LENGTH 512

  79. ‌atomic_uintnat caml_verb_gc = 0;

  81. ‌void caml_gc_log (char *msg, ...)
  82. {
  83.   if ((atomic_load_relaxed(&caml_verb_gc) & 0x800) != 0) {
  84.     char fmtbuf[GC_LOG_LENGTH];
  85.     va_list args;
  86.     va_start (args, msg);
  87.     snprintf(fmtbuf, GC_LOG_LENGTH, "[%02d] %s\n",
  88.              (Caml_state_opt != NULL) ? Caml_state_opt->id : -1, msg);
  89.     vfprintf(stderr, fmtbuf, args);
  90.     va_end (args);
  91.     fflush(stderr);
  92.   }
  93. }

  95. ‌void caml_gc_message (int level, char *msg, ...)
  96. {
  97.   if ((atomic_load_relaxed(&caml_verb_gc) & level) != 0){
  98.     va_list ap;
  99.     va_start(ap, msg);
  100.     vfprintf (stderr, msg, ap);
  101.     va_end(ap);
  102.     fflush (stderr);
  103.   }
  104. }

  106. ‌_Atomic fatal_error_hook caml_fatal_error_hook = (fatal_error_hook)NULL;

  108. ‌CAMLexport void caml_fatal_error (char *msg, ...)
  109. {
  110.   va_list ap;
  111.   fatal_error_hook hook;
  112.   va_start(ap, msg);
  113.   hook = atomic_load(&caml_fatal_error_hook);
  114.   if (hook != NULL) {
  115.     (*hook)(msg, ap);
  116.   } else {
  117.     fprintf (stderr, "Fatal error: ");
  118.     vfprintf (stderr, msg, ap);
  119.     fprintf (stderr, "\n");
  120.   }
  121.   va_end(ap);
  122.   abort();
  123. }

  125. ‌CAMLexport void caml_fatal_error_arg (const char *fmt, const char *arg)
  126. {
  127.   fprintf (stderr, fmt, arg);
  128.   exit(2);
  129. }

  131. ‌CAMLexport void caml_fatal_error_arg2 (const char *fmt1, const char *arg1,
  132.                                        const char *fmt2, const char *arg2)
  133. {
  134.   fprintf (stderr, fmt1, arg1);
  135.   fprintf (stderr, fmt2, arg2);
  136.   exit(2);
  137. }

  139. ‌void caml_ext_table_init(struct ext_table * tbl, int init_capa)
  140. {
  141.   tbl->size = 0;
  142.   tbl->capacity = init_capa;
  143.   tbl->contents = caml_stat_alloc(sizeof(void *) * init_capa);
  144. }

  146. ‌int caml_ext_table_add(struct ext_table * tbl, caml_stat_block data)
  147. {
  148.   int res;
  149.   if (tbl->size >= tbl->capacity) {
  150.     tbl->capacity *= 2;
  151.     tbl->contents =
  152.       caml_stat_resize(tbl->contents, sizeof(void *) * tbl->capacity);
  153.   }
  154.   res = tbl->size;
  155.   tbl->contents[res] = data;
  156.   tbl->size++;
  157.   return res;
  158. }

  160. ‌void caml_ext_table_remove(struct ext_table * tbl, caml_stat_block data)
  161. {
  162.   int i;
  163.   for (i = 0; i < tbl->size; i++) {
  164.     if (tbl->contents[i] == data) {
  165.       caml_stat_free(tbl->contents[i]);
  166.       memmove(&tbl->contents[i], &tbl->contents[i + 1],
  167.               (tbl->size - i - 1) * sizeof(void *));
  168.       tbl->size--;
  169.     }
  170.   }
  171. }

  173. ‌void caml_ext_table_clear(struct ext_table * tbl, int free_entries)
  174. {
  175.   int i;
  176.   if (free_entries) {
  177.     for (i = 0; i < tbl->size; i++) caml_stat_free(tbl->contents[i]);
  178.   }
  179.   tbl->size = 0;
  180. }

  182. ‌void caml_ext_table_free(struct ext_table * tbl, int free_entries)
  183. {
  184.   caml_ext_table_clear(tbl, free_entries);
  185.   caml_stat_free(tbl->contents);
  186. }

  188. /* Integer arithmetic with overflow detection */

  190. #if ! (__GNUC__ >= 5 || Caml_has_builtin(__builtin_mul_overflow))
  191. ‌CAMLexport int caml_umul_overflow(uintnat a, uintnat b, uintnat * res)
  192. {
  193. ‌#define HALF_SIZE (sizeof(uintnat) * 4)
  194. ‌#define HALF_MASK (((uintnat)1 << HALF_SIZE) - 1)
  195. ‌#define LOW_HALF(x) ((x) & HALF_MASK)
  196. ‌#define HIGH_HALF(x) ((x) >> HALF_SIZE)
  197.   /* Cut in half words */
  198.   uintnat al = LOW_HALF(a);
  199.   uintnat ah = HIGH_HALF(a);
  200.   uintnat bl = LOW_HALF(b);
  201.   uintnat bh = HIGH_HALF(b);
  202.   /* Exact product is:
  203.               al * bl
  204.            +  ah * bl  << HALF_SIZE
  205.            +  al * bh  << HALF_SIZE
  206.            +  ah * bh  << 2*HALF_SIZE
  207.      Overflow occurs if:
  208.         ah * bh is not 0, i.e. ah != 0 and bh != 0
  209.      OR ah * bl has high half != 0
  210.      OR al * bh has high half != 0
  211.      OR the sum al * bl + LOW_HALF(ah * bl) << HALF_SIZE
  212.                         + LOW_HALF(al * bh) << HALF_SIZE overflows.
  213.      This sum is equal to p = (a * b) modulo word size. */
  214.   uintnat p = a * b;
  215.   uintnat p1 = al * bh;
  216.   uintnat p2 = ah * bl;
  217.   *res = p;
  218.   if (ah == 0 && bh == 0) return 0;
  219.   if (ah != 0 && bh != 0) return 1;
  220.   if (HIGH_HALF(p1) != 0 || HIGH_HALF(p2) != 0) return 1;
  221.   p1 <<= HALF_SIZE;
  222.   p2 <<= HALF_SIZE;
  223.   p1 += p2;
  224.   if (p < p1 || p1 < p2) return 1; /* overflow in sums */
  225.   return 0;
  226. ‌#undef HALF_SIZE
  227. ‌#undef HALF_MASK
  228. ‌#undef LOW_HALF
  229. ‌#undef HIGH_HALF
  230. }
  231. #endif

  233. /* Runtime warnings */

  235. ‌uintnat caml_runtime_warnings = 0;
  236. ‌static int caml_runtime_warnings_first = 1;

  238. ‌int caml_runtime_warnings_active(void)
  239. {
  240.   if (!caml_runtime_warnings) return 0;
  241.   if (caml_runtime_warnings_first) {
  242.     fprintf(stderr, "[ocaml] (use Sys.enable_runtime_warnings to control "
  243.                     "these warnings)\n");
  244.     caml_runtime_warnings_first = 0;
  245.   }
  246.   return 1;
  247. }

  249. ‌void caml_bad_caml_state(void)
  250. {
  251.   caml_fatal_error("no domain lock held");
  252. }
